unnormalised: **Telecommunications: Fiber-to-Home Expansion Gains Momentum Across India**
normalised: telecommunications: fiber to home expansion gains momentum across india

unnormalised: New Delhi, Oct 26 - The nationwide rollout of Fiber-to-Home (FTTH) infrastructure is accelerating, bringing high-speed internet connectivity to underserved areas. Reliance Jio and Bharti Airtel continue to lead the charge, focusing on expanding their fiber optic networks deeper into Tier-2 and Tier-3 cities.
normalised: new delhi, october twenty six the nationwide rollout of fiber to home (F T T H) infrastructure is accelerating, bringing high speed internet connectivity to underserved areas. reliance jio and bharti airtel continue to lead the charge, focusing on expanding their fiber optic networks deeper into tier two and tier three cities.

unnormalised: Bharat Sanchar Nigam Limited (BSNL) is also actively upgrading its existing infrastructure, aiming to compete effectively in the increasingly competitive market. Recent reports indicate that over 50,000 km of fiber optic cable have been laid this fiscal year alone, a significant boost from the previous year.
normalised: bharat sanchar nigam limited (B S N L) is also actively upgrading its existing infrastructure, aiming to compete effectively in the increasingly competitive market. recent reports indicate that over fifty thousand kilometer of fiber optic cable have been laid this fiscal year alone, a significant boost from the previous year.

unnormalised: “Connectivity is key to India’s digital transformation, much like the connectivity displayed by Jai and Veeru in Sholay," commented Professor Sharma from IIT Bombay, a leading researcher in telecommunications. "FTTH enables high-bandwidth applications, essential for education, healthcare, and economic growth."
normalised: “connectivity is key to india’s digital transformation, much like the connectivity displayed by jai and veeru in sholay," commented professor sharma from I I T bombay, a leading researcher in telecommunications. "F T T H enables high bandwidth applications, essential for education, healthcare, and economic growth."

unnormalised: The average FTTH speed is now exceeding 100 Mbps in many urban areas. Investments in FTTH are projected to reach Rs. 20,000 crore by the end of 2024.
normalised: the average F T T H speed is now exceeding one hundred M B P S in many urban areas. investments in F T T H are projected to reach rupee twenty thousand crore by the end of two thousand and twenty four.
